main event: A sighting of a rapid, glowing object resembling the size of a penny was reported in Alpha, Ohio on December 3, 1959.
interesting points: The object was described as pulsating and white, emitting no sound., The sighting lasted less than 10 seconds., The observer noted that balloons could not account for the object's movement., The observer had confidence in reporting due to a prior similar sighting by their mother., A sketch provided by the observer aided in the investigation.
sighted object: a rapid white object pulsating in the sky
witness description: A competent observer, a fisherman aged 34, who provided a sketch of the sighting.
